title: How to Save Photos to the Cloud

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . You'll find this grey gear icon on the Home screen or by searching. Only an iOS phone or tablet can use this method.

steps.title: Tap your name and picture.
steps.content: Tap your name and picture. This is your Apple ID profile that the phone is signed in with. To access the pictures in iCloud, you'll need to log in to this Apple ID.

steps.title: Tap iCloud.
steps.content: Tap iCloud . This is usually the first listing in the second grouping. Tapping it will open your options for iCloud, including how much space is used and available as well as which apps are currently syncing with iCloud.

steps.title: Tap Photos.
steps.content: Tap Photos . This is usually the first listing in the results.

steps.title: Tap the switch on next to "iCloud Photos.
steps.content: Tap the switch on next to "iCloud Photos. " It will take a few moments for your past pictures to sync with iCloud, but current pictures will show up in iCloud automatically. Save space on your phone or tablet by tapping Optimize iPhone Storage . You can opt to activate and use My Photo Stream or Shared Albums. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open Photos .
steps.content: Open Photos . You'll find this application on your Dock or in your Applications folder.

steps.title: Click the Photos menu tab.
steps.content: Click the Photos menu tab. You'll see this next to the Apple logo in the top left corner of your screen. A menu will drop-down.

steps.title: Click Preferences.
steps.content: Click Preferences . This is usually the second listing the dropdown menu. A window will pop up.

steps.title: Click the iCloud with the icon of a cloud tab.
steps.content: Click the iCloud with the icon of a cloud tab. This is usually to the right of the "General" tab.

steps.title: Click to select the box next to "iCloud Photos.
steps.content: Click to select the box next to "iCloud Photos. " This activates more features. It will take a few moments for your past pictures to sync with iCloud, but current pictures will show up in iCloud automatically. Save space on your computer by clicking Optimize Mac Storage . You can always go through the iCloud library and download specific photos to your Mac if you need to. [2] X Research source You can opt to activate and use My Photo Stream or Shared Albums. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Download and open the Google Photos app.
steps.content: Download and open the Google Photos app. You can get it for free from the Google Play Store or App Store. You'll need to have a Google account or make one to use Google Photos. Videos larger than 10GB, photos larger than 75MB or 100MP, and items smaller than 256x256 will not be backed up. If you're using an iPhone or iPad, your Live photos will be backed up in Google Photos. [4] X Research source Sign in to Google Photos if prompted.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . You'll see this toward the top left corner of the app.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This is usually the last listing on the menu.

steps.title: Tap Back up & sync.
steps.content: Tap Back up & sync . This is usually the first listing on the menu.

steps.title: Tap the toggle next to "Back up & sync" to turn it on.
steps.content: Tap the toggle next to "Back up & sync" to turn it on. The process of syncing your past photos to Google Photos may take a while depending on how many photos and videos you have and your internet speed, but all your current photos will automatically be in Google Photos. Deleting the app will not turn off "Back up & sync." [5] X Research source You may need to give the app permission to manage your photos. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://photos.google.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://photos.google.com/ in a web browser. You can use a computer or mobile device to access the mobile site. This method will not automatically save new photos into Google Photos. Log in if prompted.

steps.title: Click Upload.
steps.content: Click Upload . You'll see this along the top of the page towards the right side, next to "Create." A menu will drop-down.

steps.title: Click Computer.
steps.content: Click Computer . Your file browser will pop up. You can also drag and drop your pictures into the Google Photos browser window to upload them.

steps.title: Navigate to and double-click the photo you want to upload.
steps.content: Navigate to and double-click the photo you want to upload. The file browser window will disappear and you will get a pop-up window of your photo when it's done uploading into Google Photos. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Download and install Backup & Sync from https://photos.google.com/apps.
steps.content: Download and install Backup & Sync from https://photos.google.com/apps . You can download the application with either a Mac or Windows computer. Use this method if you have an SD card or a connected camera or prefer using an application over a browser window.

steps.title: Open Backup & Sync.
steps.content: Open Backup & Sync. You'll need to be signed in to your Google account to proceed.

steps.title: Select to backup photos, videos, or files.
steps.content: Select to backup photos, videos, or files. You can opt to backup all photos, videos, and files, or you can specify only to backup videos.

steps.title: Select if you want to backup folders.
steps.content: Select if you want to backup folders. You can specify if you want to backup a certain folder.

steps.title: Select the upload size.
steps.content: Select the upload size. If you want to backup high-quality or compressed images, choose here. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Start.
steps.content: Click Start . The process of syncing your past photos to Google Photos may take a while depending on how many photos and videos you have and your internet speed, but all your current photos will automatically be in Google Photos. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Download and open the Dropbox app.
steps.content: Download and open the Dropbox app. You can get it for free from the Google Play Store or App Store. You'll need a current or you can create a new Dropbox account.

steps.title: Tap ☰ (Android) or Dropbox (iOS).
steps.content: Tap ☰ (Android) or Dropbox (iOS). You'll find the menu button on the top left corner of your screen, but the Dropbox button at the bottom of the screen. If you're using iOS, you can also click the settings icon in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the settings icon in the top right of the slide-out menu (Android only).
steps.content: Tap the settings icon in the top right of the slide-out menu (Android only). If you're using an iOS phone or tablet, you will not see this option.

steps.title: Tap Camera Uploads (iOS only).
steps.content: Tap Camera Uploads (iOS only). Only iOS will have to go through an extra menu to enable the feature to upload from the camera. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Camera Uploads" on (iOS) or tap Turn on camera uploads (Android).
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Camera Uploads" on (iOS) or tap Turn on camera uploads (Android). You can tap again to turn the feature off. Both iOS and Android have similar features for camera uploads, including the ability to upload only photos or videos, which data to use when uploading to Dropbox (cellular or Wi-Fi), and if the app should continue to upload while in the background [11] X Research source

steps.title: Download and install the desktop app from https://www.dropbox.com/install.
steps.content: Download and install the desktop app from https://www.dropbox.com/install . You can use this app on either a Mac or Windows computer.

steps.title: Click the Dropbox app icon on your system tray (Windows) or menu bar (Mac).
steps.content: Click the Dropbox app icon on your system tray (Windows) or menu bar (Mac). The app will open.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture.

steps.title: Click Preferences.
steps.content: Click Preferences . A window will pop up.

steps.title: Click the Import tab.
steps.content: Click the Import tab. This is along the top of the pop-up window with General , Account , Network , Notifications , and Sync .

steps.title: Click to check the box next to "Enable camera uploads for.
steps.content: Click to check the box next to "Enable camera uploads for. " The drop-down menu next to that checkbox will activate.

steps.title: Choose Photos Only or Photos and Videos.
steps.content: Choose Photos Only or Photos and Videos . Videos are generally larger and take up more space, so you might run out of free space quickly if you upload videos as well as photos.

steps.title: Click Apply or Save.
steps.content: Click Apply or Save . The process of syncing your past photos may take a while depending on how many photos and videos you have and your internet speed, but any current photos or videos will appear automatically in your Dropbox. [12] X Research source
